group_1.textLeft: I wonder...if we'll ever laugh together@again.

group_1.narration: When I had no idea what to do, Kokoro@helped me untangle my feelings.

group_1.textRight: Feel free to ignore this, but...
My family fell apart once too.
But I couldn't give up. I kept trying to@fix things on my own.
I convinced myself that I had to try@harder and kept pushing myself.
Someone told me I didn't have to endure it@on my own, that I could stop pushing myself.
Those words helped ease the burden I felt.
I realized I could slowly try to fix things@at my own pace.
So...maybe you're pushing yourself too hard?
Maybe you're blaming yourself, bottling up@your feelings?
You don't have to hold back anymore,@you can be honest.

group_1.textLeft: I want to be with my family.
I don't care if we're poor. I just want@for us to laugh together.
If I apologize... If I tell the truth...
Do you think everyone will forgive me?

group_1.textRight: So you don't want to keep lying to them.
I don't know whether or not they'll forgive@you, but...
If that's how you feel, then that's what you@should do. No matter how scary it is.

group_1.textLeft: I'm going to apologize. I want to face what@I did head-on.

group_1.narration: She quietly listened, and then gently pushed@me in the right direction.
It felt like Kokoro was...my big sister.
